Happy Valentine's Day! Meet Ezekiel, an ex-offender who has turned his life around and is now a staff at , a halfway house. He met his wife, Hannah, a school teacher at a friend's wedding and that's when their love story began. "Four years after my release, Hannah came into my life and has always been supportive, and encouraging, and she consistently listens to me and prays for me. All these have been helpful for me to get to where I am today." Ezekiel faced uncertainty upon his release, battling past failures and striving to distance himself from negative influences. Their love story echoes the message that positive transformation is possible despite past setbacks, and love can pave the way to a fulfilling future too!YellowRibbonSingapore BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances HappyValentinesDay

We're back with another !The year is 2005, one year after we launched the Yellow Ribbon Project. Though barely one-year-old, we set forth an ambitious ToDoList and took big strides to change mindsets, offer second chances, and provide opportunities for ex-offenders.We even worked with to produce 'One More Chance', a movie that highlighted the challenges ex-offenders face in the community after their release from prisons. It's not rocket science. The community ex-offenders return to may sometimes be one that is filled with prejudice about who they were and what they had done. This poses a real challenge to their reintegration as they need to break through an additional barrier to succeed.3 ways you can change this include, keep an open mind, even if you may not be able to fully understand, you can build acceptance in the community where they can be allowed to thrive in their own way.If you are willing to take a step further, lending a listening ear may help open your perspectives, inspiring those around you to become an advocate for second chances.Your support can lead to the opening of a world of opportunities for ex-offenders as they start working towards restarting their lives anew. BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSingapore

What are the things that keep you going every day? A big part of an ex-offender's rehabilitation journey is community support and finding a home with genuine and like-minded people. Sharing a passion is the icing on the cake. We sat down with Bernard Lim, together with the co-founder of Break the Cycle (BtC), Andrew Ong. They are avid cycling enthusiasts and ex-offenders who have found a common interest in a sport and various social missions.Read all about Bernard's transformative story, his words of wisdom for ex-offenders, and how Andrew got BtC started. We're marking the 20th Anniversary of the Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF) with a Charity Golf Tournament and Dinner. YRF is the first national charitable fund devoted entirely towards the development and implementation of rehabilitation and reintegration programmes for inmates, ex-offenders and their families. For enquiries about the Charity Golf and Dinner, please email Angela_swee.gov.sg.Your donations will go towards funding for rehabilitative and aftercare programmes and services for inmates before and after their release, programmes and services to support and reconnect ex-offenders and their families. For enquiries about sponsorship matters, please email carol_ho.gov.sg.YellowRibbonSingapore YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances

How does the process of forming new connections look like for ex-offenders? Yahya, an ex-offender, found a new lease of life through coaching the youth in soccer at Yuhua Albirex Football Academy. Through his passion, he not only ignited the youth's interest in soccer, but also built meaningful connections with their parents. In "Fostering Relationships," we unravel the transformative journey of ex-offenders, showcasing the incredible connections they can build post-release with strong community support. In "Fostering Relationships," we unravel the transformative journey of ex-offenders, showcasing the incredible connections they can build post-release with strong community support. This amazing win comes despite intense competition from other major industry players. This is testament to the commitment and capabilities of the team from Agape CP Holdings Pte Ltd, along with each individual in Institution A4, in ensuring that top-class service is delivered to their clients. Galvanising support, forging partnerships and striving towards change - YR Connects brought together over 100 individuals comprising employer partners, social service agencies, and industry players. This session revolved around the theme "Fostering a Supportive Workplace for Ex-offenders".Key highlights: Insights on creating a nurturing work environment Inspirations from an overcomer advocate and supportive supervisor Sharing by TAFEP on fair workplace practicesEx-offenders aren't mere recipients of second chances. When successfully reintegrated, they bring valuable contributions too. Join the Yellow Ribbon movement for a more inclusive and progressive nation! Thank you for joining us at Home Team Festival 2023! Our Yellow Ribbon Singapore Booth was a hub of hope, from the warm atmosphere at the Hope Cafe to exploring career opportunities at our Careers Booth. Visitors also joined a meaningful project, co-led by .happiness, to weave together recycled fabric in hopes of producing the largest patchwork blanket to enter the Singapore Book of Records, in support of inmates and ex-offenders.Support for the successful reintegration of ex-offenders was also displayed through the ThroughCare Journey exhibit! Participants hopped onto bicycles and with every 1km cycled, a yellow ribbon wall display lit up a little more. It stayed lit all weekend thanks to the efforts of one and all!Swipe through the recap photo album to witness the vibrant spirit of change and support. Home Team Festival 2023 may be over, but our work to drive second chances continues! HTFest2023 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances YellowRibbonSG OneHomeTeam

Breaking barriers and transforming lives! Today marked a significant milestone as Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) and Nanyang Polytechnic's Asian Culinary Institute (NYP-ACI) joined forces through a Memorandum of Understanding! This collaboration aims to boost career opportunities for inmates and ex-offenders in the food services industry. Under the TAP (Train and Place) & Grow initiative, YRSG is expanding its impact, partnering with NYP-ACI to provide industry-specific training to inmates in prison and beyond. In collaboration with NYP-ACI, inmates can pursue certifications via a 'through-train' pathway leading to advanced qualifications. Minister of State for Culture, Community and Youth & Trade and Industry, Ms Low Yen Ling, graced the occasion as the Guest-of-Honour, highlighting the importance of inclusive hiring and empowering ex-offenders. About 700 inmates annually are set to benefit from NYP-ACI's training programs, both in prison and the community, with continued support from YRSG in career fairs and job placement services. Together, let's create a positive impact, break down barriers, and build a more inclusive society! YRSGxACI YellowRibbonSingapore YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances

Minister of State for Culture, Community and Youth & Trade and Industry, Ms Low Yen Ling, graced the occasion as the Guest-of-Honour, highlighting the importance of inclusive hiring and empowering ex-offenders. About 700 inmates annually are set to benefit from NYP-ACI's training programs, both in prison and the community, with continued support from YRSG in career fairs and job placement services. Together, let's create a positive impact, break down barriers, and build a more inclusive society! YRSGxACI YellowRibbonSingapore YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances

Breaking barriers and transforming lives! Today marked a significant milestone as Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) and Nanyang Polytechnic's Asian Culinary Institute (NYP-ACI) joined forces through a Memorandum of Understanding! This collaboration aims to boost career opportunities for inmates and ex-offenders in the food services industry. Under the TAP (Train and Place) & Grow initiative, YRSG is expanding its impact, partnering with NYP-ACI to provide industry-specific training to inmates in prison and beyond. In collaboration with NYP-ACI, inmates can pursue certifications via a 'through-train' pathway leading to advanced qualifications. Minister of State for Culture, Community and Youth & Trade and Industry, Ms Low Yen Ling, graced the occasion as the Guest-of-Honour, highlighting the importance of inclusive hiring and empowering ex-offenders. About 700 inmates annually are set to benefit from NYP-ACI's training programs, both in prison and the community, with continued support from YRSG in career fairs and job placement services. Together, let's create a positive impact, break down barriers, and build a more inclusive society! YRSGxACI YellowRibbonSingapore YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances

We have PREP-ped something for you! On 20 Nov 2023, YRSG officially launched our new job portal, the Partners' Repository and Engagement Platform (PREP)! Conveniently hosted on YRSG's website, you can now access a wealth of information including skills, employment as well as the Yellow Ribbon Project (YRP) and Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF), on the same platform. PREP is a one-stop resource platform for employers and job seekers. Users can view jobs offered by YRSG employer partners from the national jobs portal, MyCareersFuture (MCF) and make use of MCF's tools such as the resume checker and "Suggested Talents" functions for greater outreach. Curated resources will be available soon to enhance the hiring experience for all users. Check it out via: Stay tuned for further feature upgrades. SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances YellowRibbonSG

Ex-offenders have to adapt to a multitude of changes after their release. Things may not be the same as they were before their incarceration, especially when it comes to relationships . But what are some of the biggest differences when it comes to family ?Hear from Dr Riduan Ishak, Executive Director of Tarkiz Pte Ltd, a company that specialises in training, team building and events. He shares how the meaning of the word 'family' has changed for him.

Exciting news! We're thrilled to announce a groundbreaking partnership between the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW) South East Asia Limited and Yellow Ribbon Fund. The Memorandum of Understanding signing at ICAEW's Annual Corporate and Award Dinner marks the beginning of a journey to empower the family members of inmates and ex-offenders in Singapore with professional certification and career opportunities in the accountancy industry. Guest-of-Honour Mr K Shanmugam, Minister for Home Affairs and Minister for Law, Singapore, together with Mr Sam Myers, His Majesty's Deputy Trade Commissioner, Department for Business and Trade, United Kingdom, witnessed this momentous event.This is a commitment to social mobility, inclusion, and second chances. Join us in celebrating this remarkable initiative in championing a brighter and more inclusive future for all. ICAEWxYRF YellowRibbonSingapore YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances

After completing their sentences in prison, adjusting to normality and reintegrating into the community after release can be an isolating and challenging time for many ex-offenders. Often, it's difficult for friends and family to know what exactly they can do to help ease that transition. One of the most important things to help ex-offenders reintegrate into the community and get back onto their feet is a strong support system that keeps them on the right path. Here are some simple things you can do to show your support for your loved one as they go through this journey of reintegration. YellowRibbonSG TieAYellowRibbon SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

For ex-offenders, it can be challenging to reintegrate into society. Getting (and staying) employed plays a big part in whether their journey is a successful one or not. We sat down with Yuzil Yusoff, a Career Coach at Careers, and asked her about the common challenges that ex-offenders may face.Read on to hear her thoughts on the attitudes they need to nurture success, and how employers themselves can help too . Who knows, her advice might help YOU out too! SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances Reintegration CareerAdvice YellowRibbonSG CareerCoach

Fraud AlertWe have received feedback that some individuals have been conducting street fundraising activities using the Yellow Ribbon Funds name.We reiterate that the Yellow Ribbon Project and Yellow Ribbon Fund do not conduct fundraising activities in this manner and we have not authorised any individuals or groups to do so in public on our behalf.If you encounter any suspicious person or persons soliciting donations in public, please report it to the police immediately.FraudAlert BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

On 21 October, the Yellow Ribbon Appreciation and Awards Ceremony 2023 recognised 186 award recipients, comprising desistors, employers, community partners and other dedicated individuals, who provided invaluable support to inmates and ex-offenders in their reintegration journey. With its core theme of "Illuminating Journeys, Overcoming Barriers", the event celebrated the community's success in shaping a more inclusive society. Participants also had opportunities to network with others who shared the same cause. The event was graced by Guest-of-Honour Mr Chan Chun Sing, Minister for Education. Minister Chan, together with Mr Phillip Tan, Chairman of YRSG; Mr Rockey Francisco Junior, Deputy Commissioner (Policy and Transformation) of Prisons from the , and Mr Sunny Lee, CEO of YRSG; expressed their solidarity towards a shared vision by tying a yellow ribbon around the oak tree. Our sincere gratitude to every individual and organisation, as well as all the volunteers, donors, workplace advocates, employers, and desistors who have contributed to our efforts. YRAAC2023 YellowRibbonSingapore YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances

The Yellow Ribbon Appreciation & Awards Ceremony 2023 will be held on 21 October to celebrate and appreciate our partners and community who champion Inclusivity and Second Chances! Supporting our cause and mobilising others to do the same is no easy feat. They have worked tirelessly behind the scenes, and we want to recognise their efforts. We share what it takes for them to be nominated and recognised across the "Advocates for Second Chances" and "Beyond Second Chances" categories. Show your support for them by giving them a in the comments! YRAAC2023 SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

What does forming new connections entail for ex-offenders? In "Fostering Relationships," we dive into the lives of ex-offenders as they navigate the path to building positive connections after their release. Kicking off this series is Chih Chung, an ex-offender who's made profound changes in his life and friendships since his release. Show him your support in the comments below as he sheds light on the transformative power of second chances and self-discovery. Interested in joining Chih Chung on his cycling adventures? Drop a DM on social media! SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

Celebrating the Singapore Logistics Association's (SLA) 50th anniversary with a meaningful step! At SLAs Golf & Dinner event held on 12 October, SLA donated $30,000 to the Yellow Ribbon Fund. Together with an earlier donation in January this year, a total of $50,000 will be dedicated to supporting ex-offenders' upskilling through the YRSGs Grow Movement. This remarkable act is part of their commitment to creating a positive impact on society. The event unveiled SLAs Vision2027, a 5-year roadmap to revolutionise Singapore's logistics industry. With a focus on sustainability, digital transformation, and workforce development, over 500 logistics companies are poised for remarkable growth. Join us in celebrating the efforts of those who make a difference in the lives of individuals seeking a second chance and beyond. SLA50 TAPandGrow GrowMovement YellowRibbonFund SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

What does 'happiness' mean to you?Introducing the Happy Moments Movement a series where we ask ex-offenders and others that very same question! To kick things off, we sat down with "Benjamin" and caught up with him about life after his release. Discover his initial anxieties, the unwavering support from his loved ones, what happiness truly means to him and how he came to the conclusion that "happiness is not something that's given to you it's you who creates it!"Tell us one of the little things in life that make YOU happy in the comments below!HappyMomentsMovement Resilience SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

A gentle smile, a friendly greeting, a willing handshake. These actions may not seem like much to you, but they mean the world to ex-offenders. Find out how you can brighten their day with some tiny gestures, and how simple actions like these can foster a more gracious and inclusive society. It's the little things that count, not just the big gestures. SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

How can we inspire change and promote Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) at work? Each of us has a role to play in creating an inclusive workplace, especially for ex-offenders. YRSG is proud to collaborate with Marina Bay Sands to organise a DEI workshop, exploring and sharing ways we can empower ex-offenders to make meaningful contributions in the workplace. Marina Bay Sands believes in inclusive hiring practices that enrich workplace diversity, and they've been our valued employer partner since 2022. This partnership highlights Marina Bay Sands and YRSG's unwavering dedication to supporting ex-offenders on their path to reintegration. Have a workplace story that resonates with our mission? Don't hesitate to reach out and share it with us. Join Marina Bay Sands and YRSG in spreading the message beyond second chances! SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG BeyondSecondChances DEIatWork

DidYouKnow? As direct recipients of second chances, some inmates also ran in tune to the spirit of the Yellow Ribbon Prison Run with you! Even though they are currently serving their sentences, they took part in the run in their own way to give back to society ! Meet reformative trainee "David" and inmate "Samuel" (not their real names), both serving sentences at Institution TM1. "David" is a participant of this year's National Youth Achievement Awards (NYAA) Programme . Every week, they ran within their institutions as part of an initiative to give back to the community. Every kilometre they completed raised funds for beneficiaries of the Yellow Ribbon Project. We joined them for one of their runs to find out what they're running for and their thoughts on what makes a truly inclusive society! Show them your support in the comments below . SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances YRPR23 BeyondPrisonWalls BehindPrisonWalls

The skies may have opened on us but it did little to drench our spirits! A big THANK YOU to all runners who braved the rain with us this morning to show our support for second chances and social inclusion! Now into its 14th edition, this year's Yellow Ribbon Prison Run (YRPR) was themed Run Beyond 2nd Chances. It signifies our resolve to establish the YRPR as a symbol of hope for inmates and ex-offenders while they progress through their rehabilitation and reintegration journey.We also want to thank Guest-of-Honour, Ms .hy, Minister for Sustainability and the Environment, for joining us in the run, alongside over 6,500 local and international participants!Together with all participants and community partners, the YRPR 2023 raised over $305,625, which will go towards providing rehabilitation and reintegration programmes for inmates, ex-offenders and their families.Lastly, for those who completed the 10KM Competitive Run, check out your race timings here: go.gov.sg/yrpr23-10kmtiming. See you at YRPR 2024 !SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances YRPR23

Samuel's (Not his real name) story is a remarkable testament to the power of second chances. With the help of Yellow Ribbon Singapore, Samuel secured a job in event management with . Despite initial nervousness, Samuel impressed his bosses with his commitment and eagerness to learn. Now, working alongside a supportive team, he thrives in his role and constantly improves. Samuel's colleagues and mentors have played a crucial role in his growth, teaching him the ropes and entrusting him with leadership tasks. His dedication, responsibility, and independence have shone through. Beyond his professional journey, Samuel draws inspiration from his family, particularly his ageing parents, who motivated him to leave behind his past mistakes.Samuel's transformation is a testament to resilience and personal growth. Yellow Ribbon Singapore celebrates journeys like Samuel's and believes in the power of second chances! SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Calling all Yellow Ribbon Prison Run 2023 participants !We hope you've enjoyed going through the contents of this year's Race Entry Pack. We're just as excited for the Run to kick off ! For those who have yet to collect their packs, you would have received an email or WhatsApp message with instructions on where to do so. If you have not collected your race pack and did not receive any update, please write in to enquiry.sg Dont forget to bring these items: Confirmation email Official proof of identity, such as NRIC (physical or digital), driver's licence or passport Student ID or matriculation card, if you registered under student rates Authorisation form completed and signed, if collecting on behalf of another participantSG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances YRPR23

Celebrate the Mid-Autumn Festival in an extra meaningful way! The 2023 Yellow Ribbon Mooncake Collection features a selection of classic and creative mooncakes, handcrafted by inmates from the Yellow Ribbon Bakery. Thats not all with every box purchased, $5 will be donated to the Yellow Ribbon Fund , the first national charitable fund devoted entirely towards the development and implementation of rehabilitation and reintegration programmes for inmates and ex-offenders. Sign up early to enjoy these delicious discounts: An Early Bird discount of 10% Limited to first 500 Second Chance Sampler Boxes only. Bulk Discount Buy 50 Boxes, Get 5 Boxes FREE. Only applicable to orders of the same mooncake flavours. While stocks last! Visit to order your mooncakes! BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances midautumnfestival

Looks like most of you agree that it is challenging for ex-offenders to find a job! Ex-offenders encounter a variety of challenges as they work towards reintegrating into the community, and some of you have a good idea of what they are. When it comes to helping ex-offenders with employment, Yellow Ribbon Singapore plays a key role. From developing future-ready skills to connecting them with prospective employers, we help facilitate the process every step of the way. SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSG

Our heartiest congratulations to the winners and participants of this years Yellow Ribbon Culinary Competition (YRCC) 2023! The winning dishes will be a part of Kitchen Haus Group Pte Ltds catering menu. Sotong Stick Teriyaki Hawaiian Burger Brownies With Love In collaboration with and , YRCC empowers ex-offenders and inmates to acquire the skills that are useful for a career in F&B. Working with alumni from HCSA Academy, the inmate participants were mentored over two months to create unique plant-based dishes as part of this years theme - Planting Seeds of Change. YRCC2023 PlantingSeedsOfChange SG4SecondChances

On 27 July, the CARE Network Summit 2023 delved into the topic of desistance - what can the desistance journey look like, and how can the community support the people on it?Grounded on the theme "Desistance in the CommUNITY", community leaders, desistors, as well as researchers and partners, came together to exchange knowledge and initiatives.The event was graced by Guest-of-Honour Mr K Shanmugam, Minister for Home Affairs and Minister for Law, who joined key partners to participate in a commitment activity, affirming efforts to lower recidivism rates and develop the capabilities of community partners and volunteers.A partnership between YRSG and was also announced to distribute donated pre-loved clothes to vulnerable communities including residents from Selarang Halfway House.YellowRibbonSingapore SG4SecondChances

Reintegrating into the community can be tough, even more so when crippled by self-doubt. Self-doubt has the potential to cripple even the best of us, let alone an ex-offender whos facing a host of other challenges. As family and loved ones, you are their first line of defence. So, heres a couple of tips from us to help you identify signs of self-doubt and manage them at home.Final Pro Tip: A caregiver should not be afraid to seek help too your health is equally, if not, more important. TieAYellowRibbon SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

A hawker's life is not for everyone. Being a hawker means being on your feet for hours, within a hot and humid space.This is something Samuel Tan does not mind, in fact, he thrives in this environment. From being the apprentice of a Chicken Rice franchise , Samuel is now his own boss. Samuel, who is an ex-offender, pays it forward by hiring ex-offenders too. He hopes that by giving a second chance to others, the society can be inspired to do the same too. "A celebrity chef had become a regular customer to my stall and when I recognised him, I asked him how my food was. He said what I'm doing was very good , and this became the highlight of my time as a chef so far," Samuel shared. SG4SecondChances OKChickenRice

HaveYouMet Nur'ain Ahmad, who is a Principal Associate (Yellow Ribbon Project) at Yellow Ribbon Singapore? The Yellow Ribbon Project (YRP) is a movement that inspires the community to help build a more inclusive society and give ex-offenders a second chance in life. Part of Nur'ain's role is to find creative ways to showcase the skills and talents of inmates and ex-offenders through YRP events, which in turn gives them an opportunity to pay it forward and give back to the community. "My most memorable experience at YRSG was when i got to witness the Yellow Ribbon PAC Alumni band perform at the Red Dot Concert last year. From first seeing all of them performing when they were incarcerated, to witnessing their performance at a bigger platform at Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay and seeing the audience singing along with them and cheering them on." If you're looking for a fulfilling career in providing the gift of a second chance, head to to apply. SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

"I refuse to let my past define me. I was determined to show my value to society and my daughters." David King Thorairajan, an ex-offender, founder of life coaching programme, The Ministry of Empowerment, and father of two girls, ages six and nine, opens up about the unique challenges he faced and conquered on his journey to becoming a loving dad. "Bonding with my kids wasn't always easy, especially when they grew older. But I've learnt that speaking their language, embracing their interests, and being a cool dad goes a long way." David recognises the importance of being a role model as a husband and father; both in the way he treats his wife and in his commitment to a healthy lifestyle. His determination to improve his health not only inspires his daughters but also ensures that he's there for them every step of the way. "Consistency is key. Changing habits take time, but pressing on day by day, week by week, brings about positive transformation." This Father's Day, we celebrate David's incredible journey of redemption and the unwavering love he has for his daughters. Happy Father's Day! : David King ThorairajanSG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances HappyFathersDay

The Yellow Ribbon Culinary Competition (YRCC) 2023 Grand Finale was held on 15 June 2023 in Changi Prison Complex . Organised by the Yellow Ribbon project, , and , this competition equips inmates and ex-offenders with culinary skills so that they may consider working in the F&B industry after their release. For the first time, ex-offenders have also been invited as co-participants to form teams with the inmate participants! We are proud of our talented chefs-to-be who showcased their creativity and resilience to create the remarkable plant-based dishes. Their dedication inspires us to believe in the power of second chances, as well as the inmates' and ex-offenders' potential for positive change. Together, let's celebrate their culinary journey and support their transition towards a brighter future. Thank you, , Senior Minister of State for Ministry of Sustainability and Environment & Ministry of Transport, along with partners, sponsors and the families of the participants, who had supported the participants and try out their creative dishes! YRCC2023 CulinaryTalent SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Meet Mohamed Rafi Bin Yahya Marican, who is determined to turn his life around. Having served a sentence of three years in prison for drug consumption, Rafi embarked on a remarkable journey of self-improvement and growth. Rafi currently works as a Technical and Safety Coordinator at Gain Max Construction & Engineering Pte Ltd. He shares, "This company is a fantastic place to learn and gain valuable experience. I hope that more organisations can create opportunities for ex-offenders and support their transformation in life, just like my company did." Mr. Spencer Chia, Chairman at Gain Max Construction & Engineering Pte Ltd, believes in providing opportunities for ex-offenders to thrive. "When hiring ex-offenders, we look for physical fitness and mental clarity, along with a willingness to take on new roles. If you give them the chance to renew their lives and contribute to society, they may surprise you with their dedication and potential. It's a win-win!"By supporting second chances, companies can help reduce recidivism rates, strengthen communities and promote a more inclusive and compassionate society for ex-offenders. SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Introducing Nah Khim Cheng, Assistant Director (Technology) at Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG)! A self-proclaimed 'Project Ninja', he oversees the development and implementation of various applications in YRSG, keeping them operational and efficient to help increase productivity and minimise errors at work. In the face of increasing cyberattacks, Khim Cheng and his team have been instrumental in fortifying YRSG's cybersecurity measures! Their tireless efforts have mitigated outages and successfully deterred major security incidents, ensuring the safety and integrity of our systems.Reflecting on his most memorable experience, Khim Cheng fondly recalls the challenges and rewards of the COVID-19 pandemic. When the nation was caught off-guard, he and his team swiftly deployed remote working solutions, harnessed the power of task automation and introduced SG Teams for enhanced collaboration. His unwavering dedication and innovative approach have been instrumental in overcoming obstacles and driving YRSG forward. We spoke with Ms Tan Wee Zi, our newly promoted Deputy Director in Strategy, to discuss her journey at Yellow Ribbon Singapore. Ms Tan was a Senior Assistant Director in Strategy, overseeing the Policy, Research & Analytics unit. Following her promotion, she will also oversee the Planning & Transformation unit. When asked about an impactful experience at work, Ms Tan excitedly shared, "A memorable project was the launch of the Uplifting Employment Credit, a wage offset scheme, which YRSG worked closely with Ministry of Manpower and (SPS) to develop. This project would not have come to fruition without the dedicated YRSG, SPS, and MOM staff to push through this initiative." Prior to Yellow Ribbon Singapore, Ms Tan worked at SPS as a CaptainOfLives and managed the daily operations of a Drug Rehabiliation Centre. Having worked in both in-care and aftercare, Ms Tan shared, "I'm thankful to be able to contribute towards the broader mission of both SPS and YRSG, which is to reduce recidivism and help ex-offenders reintegrate into society." Congratulations, Ms Tan, on your well-deserved promotion! Your dedication and passion for creating an inclusive society for ex-offenders are truly inspiring. We look forward to seeing your continued contributions at Yellow Ribbon Singapore! If you would like to pursue fulfilling career opportunities and positively impact the lives of inmates and ex-offenders, JoinUs via the link in our bio! On 1 August 2023, Mr Matthew Wee Yik Keong will handover the reins as CEO of Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) and Yellow Ribbon Industries (YRI) to Mr Lee Chin Hon, Sunny. Mr Wee's leadership has been instrumental in restructuring and transforming YRSG to uplift the lives of ex-offenders and promote second chances. Under his guidance, YRSG and YRI launched new strategic directions and embraced innovation. The Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF) also raised $8 million for 16,000 ex-offenders and their families during the pandemic. We extend our heartfelt gratitude for Mr Wee's exceptional leadership and significant contributions, and we wish him all the best in his new role as Deputy Commissioner (Operations and Rehabilitation) at the ! YRSG also welcomes Mr Lee to the YR family. Mr Lee brings a wealth of experience from the Ministry of Home Affairs () and a track record of driving transformation and excellence. With Mr Lee's leadership, we are confident that YRSG will continue championing hope, forgiveness, acceptance, and second chances, building a safer and more inclusive Singapore. SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

On 13 May 2023, the (SAL) organised the Chief Justice's Cup , an annual charity Futsal tournament.Special thanks to the various legal firms for their incredible support and showcasing their Futsal skills with great enthusiasm! More than $165,000 was raised for the Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF)! The funds raised from the event will be dedicated entirely to funding rehabilitation and aftercare programmes that facilitate inmates' and ex-offenders' reintegration into the community. SAL has been a strong advocate of YRF since 2013 and has contributed over $600,000 towards the YRF - SAL STAR Bursary, benefiting 47 deserving students. Thank you for your unwavering support and enthusiasm!Together, let's pledge to make a difference in the lives of inmates and ex-offenders who strive for a better life. Happy Mother's Day to all the amazing moms out there! Today, we're excited to share the story of Ellyana Bte Ramlee, on her journey as a mother and in particular, how she overcame challenges while serving time in prison. Ellyana shared how becoming a mother at a young age motivated her to work hard and provide the best for her son. "I wanted to carry all the responsibilities on my own," she said. However, serving time in prison was a difficult time for Ellyana and her family, especially when it came to being separated from her son. "It was heartbreaking to lie to my son about my whereabouts," she shared. Rebuilding her relationship with her son after her release was another obstacle for Ellyana. "I had a lot of fears and doubts about myself," she shared. "I didn't want him to be overwhelmed by my presence after being away for quite some time." Balancing motherhood and work can be challenging, but Ellyana tries to make the best of her off days, planning fun activities with her son. The most important lesson Ellyana hopes to pass on to her children is that "it's okay to seek help if you need to. Nothing to be embarrassed about and it will not make you look weak." Ellyana's experience as a mother has also influenced her work with other ex-offenders and their families. "I hope that my stories have educated them better and that they can seek treatment for their children from the different organisations that offer help," she said. For Mother's Day this year, Ellyana is celebrating with her family at home as it coincides with her son's 15th birthday. Thank you, Ellyana, for sharing your inspiring story with us! Happy Mother's Day! HappyMothersDay SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

On 10 May 2023, the SPS-YRSG Corporate Advance at Suntec Convention Centre had over 600 attendees, including halfway houses and social service agencies. Themed "Forward Corrections: Strengthening Partnerships", the event emphasised the importance of partnership with the community to help inmates and ex-offenders achieve successful desistance. At the event, Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) announced the expansion of the TAP (Train and Place) & Grow inmate skills training programme. It will include the food services sector, and will benefit about 700 inmates to undergo relevant training.Two other initiatives will also be introduced to support ex-offenders career progression beyond the TAP & Grow sectors: The Grow Movement, a post-release partial training sponsorship scheme that includes qualifications up to Diploma level.YR Sandbox, which offers career opportunities to inmates in emerging and fast-growing sectors such as in the Digital economy, Green economy and Built environment. Together, and YRSG will continue to partner the community to support the inmates and ex-offenders in their rehabilitation and reintegration to lower recidivism rates.SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

"From Prison Bars to Mountain Peaks" Meet , an ex-offender-turned-entrepreneur who found his solace in an unconventional sport: Mountaineering. Andyn's journey wasn't easy. He shared with us how he managed to turn his life around, after being admitted into the Singapore Boy's Home in his teenage years and eventually into prison."I constantly set goals for myself to keep me motivated and occupied. I also do a lot of volunteering work, such as engagements in Changi Prison Complex and juvenile homes, to make myself accountable, which reminds me not to go back to my old ways," he shared. As a business owner, Andyn has faced challenges because of his tattoos. But he continues to push forward and even hires ex-offenders, giving them a second chance. "I am still open to giving anyone a second chance despite that," he said. Andyn discovered a passion for mountaineering while working in a gym for 18 years. He believes it can be an outlet for other ex-offenders too. "It teaches me patience, humility, and resilience," he said, adding that he is always looking for like-minded sponsors to support his cause. For beginners who want to try mountaineering, Andyn recommends starting with day hikes in Malaysia before progressing to multiple-day hikes.SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Happy Labour Day! Today, Yellow Ribbon Singapore celebrates ex-offenders who turned their lives around and contribute positively to society. Your hard work has made Singapore a better place to live in, and we are grateful for your tireless support and efforts. HappyLabourDay YellowRibbonSG SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Happy International Guitar Month! Meet Upu and Razif -two passionate musicianswho are breaking barriers andcommonstereotypes of ex-offenders! They used their past experiences to fuel their creative process as part of the Yellow Ribbon PAC Alumni Band.We spent some time with them at a jam session. Upu shared with us his preference for the Fender Stratocaster (USA or Japan) for the feel of the fretboard and maple neck, and prefers Takamine for acoustic guitars. On the other hand, Razif prefers the design of Gibson Les Paul USA and its solid fretboard.Upu admitted that he finds it challenging to get his friends to steer clear of bad company, who may still be involved in illicit drugs. However, he constantly advises them in whatever way he can. Razif, as the band's drummer, is focused on music and jams with his members weekly. Currently, the band is working on a collaboration project with , a group of arts enthusiasts. You can also catch them performing live at the , which advocates the removal of prejudicial, negative labels in our society and puts across the message that labels do not matter but people do. Dont miss the performance on 24 June 2023 at the OCBC Square, Singapore Sports Hub!What an inspiring story! Keep rockin', Upu and Razif!!SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances InternationalGuitarMonth

We have exciting news! Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) and FairPrice Group (FPG) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to provide employment and training opportunities for ex-offenders in the food services, logistics, and retail sectors. This partnership aims to:1 Develop upskilling and career development pathways for ex-offenders.2 Foster an inclusive and accepting workplace environment.NTUC FairPrice Foundation has also pledged $200,000 to the Yellow Ribbon Fund to assist ex-offenders to continue upskilling after their release. We're proud to be part of a community effort and look forward to continue building a more inclusive society for ex-offenders!Thank you Ms .sg, for attending the MOU signing ceremony! SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances InclusiveSociety SocialResponsibility

Meet Azmi Abdul Rahman, who was incarcerated for drug-related offences over a decade ago. He currently works as a bus driver , picking up and dropping off his regular passengers daily and ensuring that they reach their destinations safely and promptly.Azmi found this job through an online job advertisement during the pandemic and finds it rewarding as he is passionate about driving and enjoys interacting with his passengers.Having been thrown multiple curveballs in life, such as losing his brother to a drug overdose, Azmi has emerged stronger today and found the strength and motivation to live every day to its fullest. To all ex-offenders and those who are still trying to find their way, Azmi has a message for them: "Anything is possible if you take the first step and trust in yourself!" As the festive season is here, Azmi is excited to see his kids' faces light up with joy during the holiday. So, get ready to celebrate with Azmi and his family. Wishing all celebrants "Selamat Hari Raya!" SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChancesSelamatHariRaya

Ah Tan's journey is inspiring - as an ex-offender, he overcame his past and emerged as the champion of a culinary competition . But that is just the beginning of his journey, as he continues to pursue his passion and hone his skills, eventually venturing into entrepreneurship .Chef Royce, who inspired this heartwarming comic, reminds us that no matter what our past looks like, we all have the potential to turn our lives around and achieve greatness with support from the community.SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

Attention all employers! Are you open to hiring ex-offenders? Providing employment opportunities for ex-offenders can help them rebuild their lives and also bring value to your team . Their potential and positive impact on your organisation may surprise you!In addition, the government has introduced the Uplifting Employment Credit (UEC) in Budget 2023, a wage offset scheme designed to support employers who hire ex-offenders . This scheme is applicable to ex-offenders hired between April 2023 and December 2025.By hiring ex-offenders, you can join us in making a positive impact on our community and supporting their reintegration into society.Terms and conditions apply. Find out more at the link in our bio. Be part of a social cause and make a difference with us!UEC SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Hazirah Hoh, a Senior Assistant Career Specialist at Careers, plays a vital role in helping ex-offenders reintegrate into society after their release from prison . She assists them in mapping out their career aspirations and charting a path for them to achieve their goals. With five years of experience on her belt, Hazirah is passionate about her work and takes pride in seeing her clients secure jobs that are aligned with their interests.Hazirah's greatest challenge is helping her clients believe in their strengths and capabilities. "Many of them doubt their abilities and worry about the social stigma surrounding ex-offenders." Hazirah finds motivation in hearing success stories from employers, which drive her to continue improving her skills to assist her clients better.Through her work, Hazirah believes that by providing gainful employment and helping her clients chart their career pathways, they can successfully reintegrate into society and contribute back in their own ways. YRSG provides fulfilling career opportunities for individuals passionate about positively impacting the lives of inmates and ex-offenders.JoinUsvia the link in our bio!SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

On International Women's Day, be inspired by Liaw Li Qing, an associate from Yellow Ribbon Singapore who is passionate about helping ex-offenders and sports. She is an avid tchoukball player who has played for about ten years since her polytechnic days. Her dedication to the sport is evident - she trains four days a week for her national and club training! For Li Qing, the best thing about playing tchoukball is the bond she shares with her teammates. "We play the competition together, win/lose together, and cover for each other," she shared. Recently, Singapore's women's tchoukball team made history by becoming world champion, and she couldn't be prouder of her team's achievement. "Getting champion for last year's Asia games led us to be world No. 1, but there was also a lot of hard work put in by all the other ex-national women players who helped us get there," she shared.When asked about the most important message she wants to send to young women thinking of pursuing sports in a male-dominated environment, Li Qing responded simply, "Go for it!" We love Li Qing's passion for sports and commitment to her job and tchoukball, and we hope her story can inspire more young women to persevere and pursue their passions! Once again, Happy IWDDay! InternationalWomensDay EmbraceEquity SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Thank you for supporting second chances! Wong Fong Academy (WFA), an educational institute, provides skill training courses across all industrial sectors, such as Aerial Drone, Food Safety and many more. Not only do they support hiring ex-offenders, WFA has also been training inmates in Changi Prison Complex on how to operate forklifts since 2018!"Employers need to be more socially responsible. If we don't stop discriminating against inmates and ex-offenders, they will most likely continue their cycle of crime as they are unable to find a stable career," shared Jefferson Tan, overall in-charge of training programmes at WFA. Interestingly, WFA also hired Boon Keng (who was featured on Inside Maximum Security and Beyond Maximum Security) as a trainer! Join us in supporting second chances to create a more inclusive society for inmates, ex-offenders and their familiesSG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

The emotional turmoil from the incarceration of a loved one is never easy. Find the strength to move forward alongside your loved one and check out our 'Tie a Yellow Ribbon' Series. Our guide offers practical advice, from communication skills , housing and employment to rebuilding relationships and managing stress. We've got you covered whether you're a parent, sibling, spouse, or friend.If you have a loved one in prison or just released, remember that you can be a tremendous help and resource for them. Together, we can make a difference and build a brighter future for our loved ones! TieAYellowRibbon SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

Meet Chris Chia, a social worker who turned his life around after serving seven incarcerations to find love and a new purpose in life. After serving his most recent sentence in 2021, Chris was determined to start a new chapter in his life and pursue his dreams. Through hard work and determination, he eventually attained a Bachelors Degree in Social Sciences from .I met my wife, Elsa, when I was overseas during my student exchange in 2017. We got married in 2019. She re-located to Singapore in 2021 and we are finally living together after almost four years of long-distance relationship. It was difficult but we persevered and overcame the distance and difficulties.One of their fondest memories would be the time when they were walking along the streets of Hong Kong in the middle of the night. There was a light drizzle and as they neared Elsa's home, Chris stopped in the middle of the empty road, held up both her hands, looked into her eyes and asked her to be his girlfriend, to which she agreed! Chris goes on to describe how Elsa supported him, "Many ex-offenders come out from prison broken, wounded, and doubtful of acceptance, but for me, Elsa's love and support were paramount in encouraging me, and guiding me through acceptance and validation."An integral member of their family, Big Nose has been with Chris for 10 years! The soft toy was a source of comfort for Elsa, who formed a strong attachment to it during Chris incarceration. Big Nose was with her throughout that time, and I believe that he is to her a personification of me. Now that all three of us are together, she would sometimes lament that I am spending more time with him than her!" With a shared love of travelling and enjoying new experiences, Chris and Elsas story is a testament to the power of redemption, second chances, and the resilience of the human spirit. We hope that it inspires others to believe in the power of love and the possibility of a brighter future, no matter what their past may hold.Happy Valentine's Day!SG4SecondChances HappyValentinesDay

To help prepare inmates and ex-offenders to rejoin the workforce , Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) works closely with community partners and employers to provide skills training and employment assistance, such as career placement and career retention. In 2022, YRSG provided employment assistance to more than 2,500 inmates, of which 94% secured jobs upon their release from prisons. These jobs were mainly in wholesale and retail trade, transportation and storage, administrative and support services, and accommodation and food services industries.YRSG will continue to build a sustainable ecosystem of support to help reintegrate inmates and ex-offenders into the community and prevent re-offending.BeyondSecondChancesSG4SecondChances

The biennial Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF) Charity Gala Dinner, held on 3 February 2023, raised over $1 million in donations to support inmates, ex-offenders, and their families. Since its inception in 2004, YRF has disbursed over $19 million to assist 64,000 inmates and ex-offenders through initiatives like the YRF Skills Training Assistance to Re-start (STAR) Bursary, which enables ex-offenders with low income to pursue higher academic qualifications, and the Yellow Brick Road (YBR) programme, which provides case management services and support for vulnerable families with children. The event was graced by Guest-of-Honour, Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies, Mr Tharman Shanmugaratnam, alongside over 106 generous corporate and individual donors who attended the event. YRF will continue to expand its support for inmates, ex-offenders, and their families to inspire hope and create an inclusive society. YellowRibbonFund BeyondSecondChancesSG4SecondChances

The biennial Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF) Charity Gala Dinner, held on 3 February 2023, raised over $1 million in donations to support inmates, ex-offenders, and their families. Since its inception in 2004, YRF has disbursed over $19 million to assist 64,000 inmates and ex-offenders through initiatives like the YRF Skills Training Assistance to Re-start (STAR) Bursary, which enables ex-offenders with low income to pursue higher academic qualifications, and the Yellow Brick Road (YBR) programme, which provides case management services and support for vulnerable families with children. The event was graced by Guest-of-Honour, Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies, Mr Tharman Shanmugaratnam, alongside over 106 generous corporate and individual donors who attended the event. YRF will continue to expand its support for inmates, ex-offenders, and their families to inspire hope and create an inclusive society. YellowRibbonFund BeyondSecondChancesSG4SecondChances

Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) successfully held its first outreach event this year on 13 January 2023. In collaboration with , YR Connects was held in conjunction with the EveryWorkerMatters conversations. Over 80 partner employers, partners from trade associations and social service agencies shared their thoughts, challenges faced and ideas to achieve a more inclusive workforce that supports second chances.At the event, Matthew Wee Yik Keong, YRSG's Chief Executive Officer, shared words of encouragement and thanked employers for their support and trust towards ex-offenders, uplifting their lives through meaningful employment and training.Join us on this journey to help ex-offenders reintegrate into society and stay tuned for more exciting initiatives! BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances EveryWorkerMatters EveryWorkerMattersConversation

" - ." Introducing Ms Gladys Png, Associate, Strategy, who spearheads digitalisation at Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) to enhance programmes and services for inmates and ex-offenders. Ms Png's work entails leveraging data and digital tools to identify key trends that improve processes and in turn help with operational decisions. Recounting her most memorable experience in her 5-year career with YRSG, Ms Png recalls an educational tour that she organised for community partners to Japan to study their volunteer probation officers programme. Ms Png is a strong believer of making possibilities a reality through her work and stands by YRSG's HOPE (H: Honour, O: Oneness P: People-oriented, E: Enterprising) values, inspiring individuals to uplift ex-offenders through skills and career development, and co-creating opportunities to help them reintegrate and contribute back to community. YRSG offers rewarding careers for those who want to make a difference in the lives of inmates and ex-offenders. Click on the link in the bio to learn more! JoinUsSG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

The story of Mustakem Bin Mohamed Rais, a SANA Peer Mentor and Tasek Jurong Beneficiary, exemplifies perseverance and hard work for a new beginning and a second chance in life.Since his release in 2011, Mustakem has since gotten married and started a family, and dedicates time to the SANA Peer Leaders programme, guiding recovering drug abusers to get on the right track and start afresh, just like himself. A loving father to six children, Mustakem shared his parenting style, "Both parents need to be team players. My wife disciplines our kids, while I complement it with a reward system to motivate them, such as occasionally having a fun day out. Spending quality time and creating new experiences with our children is also essential." Parents play a key role in helping to shape their children's future. By being physically and emotionally available for them, parents can keep their children away from criminal influences.SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

Meet Ms Dazhini Raja Naran, Senior Associate, Private Partnership Scheme (Skills), who has been with Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) for 7 years and counting!Ms Dazhini works with private enterprises to provide inmates with work programme opportunities in prison. These work programmes help inmates develop positive work ethics and skills that will help them in their jobs after release.Ms Dazhini shares that her work gives her great satisfaction. She added, Reviewing the impact of work programmes on inmates' rehabilitation and employability outcomes has made me discover new perspectives on how they can function differently as part of the workforce, both internally in prison and externally in society."Keen on being a part of Yellow Ribbon Singapore and play a part in transforming lives, like Ms Dazhini? Head to the link in bio to check out our career page!SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

"To fellow ex-offenders, don't be scared to try new things even though you might have zero experience. However, always be responsible, and keep yourself away from drugs!" - Yasman Mohd Sultan BadYasman was incarcerated for drug offences but continued to upgrade himself by obtaining a forklift license during his incarceration. He received a Certificate in Logistics Operations under the TAP and Grow Logistics initiative, in collaboration with Singapore Logistics Association (SLA), which trains and places inmates and ex-offenders within the logistics sector. Yasman eventually managed to secure a job at Yang Kee Logistics, an SLA member company. According to Yang Kee, Yasman aced the interview! Almost six months into the job, Yasman has proven to be a hardworking and independent employee who is eager to learn!Jack Khoo, Senior Manager at Yang Kee Logistics, shared, "Hiring logistics-trained ex-offenders is an alternative source of recruitment, and allows us to build a more inclusive society by reintegrating ex-offenders into the workforce. We have placed over three ex-offenders with our contract logistics arm and are heartened that the programme has received positive feedback from our team and the hires."Everyone makes mistakes, but we should not let their past define their future. Yellow Ribbon Singapore hopes to continue collaborating with more organisations to provide employment opportunities to ex-offenders! SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

Founded in 2004, the Yellow Ribbon Fund (YRF) is the first national charitable organisation dedicated to the development and implementation of rehabilitation and reintegration programmes for inmates and ex-offenders, as well as family support programmes to strengthen their family bonds. Join us for an evening of second chances and new beginnings, on 3 February 2023 at the Ritz Carlton for the YRF Charity Gala Dinner to raise funds for a meaningful cause.SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

"We hire without discrimination and keep an open mind when people with past criminal records apply. We are also open to hiring inmates who had worked with us in our workshops, should they express interest to continue working with us upon release." Dedicated to supporting second chances, Boxgreen, a local plant-based snack social enterprise, collaborates with to provide training programmes for inmates to enhance their employability after release. The enterprise also offers regular employment to ex-offenders, like Rebecca Fong, who has been gainfully employed since 2019 and worked her way up to a managerial role.Rebecca shared that she focused on learning , building her career, and securing gainful employment after her release. With strong social support from her mother, Rebecca remained on the right side of the law and expressed her appreciation to the CaptainsOfLives from SPS, who supported and guided her throughout her incarceration. Today, she is a supervisor at JuixUp SG, a sister company of Boxgreen, where she oversees operations and sales. According to her boss, Andrew Lim, General Manager of JuixUp, Rebecca is an exemplary employee who is very passionate about her professional role and holds herself to a high standard. Like Rebecca, having stable employment support gives ex-offenders a sense of purpose and an opportunity to reintegrate into society successfully. YRSG will continue to work with more organisations to provide more employment opportunities to ex-offenders who yearn for a second chance in life! SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

In line with Singapores aim to achieve net zero emission by 2050, the Green Nation Pledge was launched to encourage individuals and organisations to take action to make Singapore a green, liveable and climate-resilient home. YRSG has pledged to be a contributor! You, too can play a part by submitting your pledge via the link in our bio! Together, we can make a difference towards a cleaner and greener Singapore! GreenNationPledgeSG

"I am proud to play an important role in helping ex-offenders overcome their past and rebuild their relationships with their families!" Ms Eu Chin Yen, a Senior Associate (Partnership) at Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG), works closely with employers to create sustainable career opportunities for ex-offenders. By engaging and onboarding employers as partners, she ensures that inmates and ex-offenders have access to a pool of career opportunities, so that they can be gainfully employed after release, improving their chances for successful reintegration. Ms Eu recalls her most memorable experience at YRSG, "Through close collaboration with my Career Specialist colleagues, I managed to secure a promising business development role for an ex-offender. He flourished and was able to utilise his strengths to help grow the company and bring it to further heights. We were delighted to learn that the partner employer appreciated our efforts in helping them secure a suitable candidate." If you want to play a part in transforming lives, apply for a rewarding career at Yellow Ribbon Singapore via the link in our bio! SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

This year's Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022 showcased original art and poetry by inmates, supervisees and ex-offenders, as well as music performances, merchandise for sale and various free art workshops. We want to thank everyone for showing up to support second chances and we hope that you had fun with your friends and family! The talented inmates, ex-offenders and supervisees have expressed their hopes and wishes for a second chance, so do help us to support their journey towards successful reintegration. Take a look at these photos taken at the YR CAF 2022 and spot yourself there! Head on over to the Yellow Ribbon Singapore Facebook page to view the rest of the photos! YRCAF2022SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

The talented inmates, ex-offenders and supervisees have expressed their hopes and wishes for a second chance, so do help us to support their journey towards successful reintegration. Take a look at these photos taken at the YR CAF 2022 and spot yourself there! Head on over to the Yellow Ribbon Singapore Facebook page to view the rest of the photos! YRCAF2022SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

A Peek At Home "While painting this piece, I had mixed feelings - sadness, anger, excitement, and many other emotions. When I found out that the theme for the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022 was 'Home', I was lost and confused as I had never experienced or found a place I could call 'home'.I finally decided that I could paint what I would love to find in a home, hence the keyhole in the painting when I peep through it, it depicts whatever 'home' is to me, and what I want to see in it."In Sarah's (not real name) art, she expresses her hopes and desires through beautiful brush strokes and vibrant colours. She is also an aspiring tattoo artist; her parents have given their full blessings and hope to be there for her throughout her journey to success and reintegration into society! Show your support for Sarah's artwork alongside many talented inmate artists who are waiting to be discovered. You can adopt their artworks too! View the full catalogue at the link in our bio or visit the event at and check it out in person today!YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

/dkup/1. The art or craft of decorating objects with paper cut-outs.You may think dcoupage is a fancy term for Victorian-era home decor. However, the Green Haven Halfway House (GH HWH) residents are here to show you otherwise!The decoupage workshop is one of many rehabilitation programmes at GH HWH. During the workshop, paper cut-outs are applied on a surface, and then coated with several finishing layers, such as lacquer or varnish. The end result - beautiful pieces of artwork that look great in any setting! Check out their intricate artworks and even buy a few to adorn your home, exclusively at the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022!Head down to , on 12 and 13 November 2022 and show your support for second chances!YRCAF2022SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

Are you looking for art pieces to elevate your home decor or gift to your loved ones? Why not adopt one from our talented inmate artists? Art is a beautiful expression of one self . Adopting an artwork from inmate artists is a unique way to support the Yellow Ribbon cause and encourage inmates, supervisees and ex-offenders to pursue their passion further and become contributing members of society. The Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022 is a one-of-a-kind experience that allows you to get into the minds of the artist and discern their desire to turn over a new leaf upon their release from prison. You can show your support by adopting the exclusive artworks featured, while stocks last! Check out the exhibition from 5 to 13 November at (Colonnade), or simply visit the online catalogue at the link in bio and register your interest! YRCAF2022SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

It's finally here! The Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022 was launched yesterday at by Guest-of-Honour Mr , Minister for Culture, Community and Youth and Second Minister for Law! The iconic SuperTree was lit up in yellow, and a token of appreciation was presented to Minister Tong and key partners from Gardens By the Bay, and , followed by a guided tour by the exhibition curator Mr John Tung. We would like to offer our gratitude to Minister Tong, CARE Network partners and volunteers for joining us in this journey to support second chances! Join us to support second chances and emerging artists in Singapore by visiting the Festival! The art exhibition is open daily from 5 to 13 November 2022!. Find out morevia link in bio! (P.S. You can adopt artworks too!) YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Fun Fact: Did you know Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG) was called the Singapore Corporation of Rehabilitative Enterprises (SCORE) before its rebranding in 2020? Meet Mrs Chin-Loo Guat Sim, Senior Associate (Finance), Corporate Service, who kickstarted her journey in 1977, decades before the rebranding. This year, she officially marks her 45th year in service and her contributions to YRSG's mission by ensuring proper financial management and governance. When asked about her greatest challenge at work, she shared, "Technology changes rapidly in our course of work, and the constant need to adapt to it is the greatest challenge for me. "Key HR and finance systems are evolving all the time and we need to be able to use them efficiently. Thankfully, utilising technology at work has opened up opportunities for a more efficient and productive work process over the years." Mrs Chin-Loo fondly recalls her fun experiences at work with her team members, such as the Yellow Ribbon Flag Day, durian feasts and even a short trip to Batam! If you too are motivated to help rebuild lives and champion second chances, a meaningful career at Yellow Ribbon Singapore awaits you! Apply for our open positions via the link in our bio today! SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

The Yellow Ribbon Community Art Festival (YR CAF) 2022 exhibits various art pieces that illustrate the efforts that inmate artists, ex-offenders and supervisees make to break out of their comfort zones by embracing art, as a form of self-expression, under the nurturing guidance of artist mentors. The YR CAF 2022, happening from 5 to 13 November 2022 will feature artwork and poetry exhibitions, as well as baked treats and merchandise for sale, and live music performances over two weekends!There will be free weekend workshops such as crocheting, mondrian painting and miniature home building, sign up on our link in bio now! In partnership with and , YR CAF 2022 is a one-of-a-kind experience that allows the inmate artists to express their desires to change for their families. Don't miss this opportunity to show your support for second chances and emerging artists in Singapore. See you at the festival! YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Art lovers unite!Arts and crafts can be therapeutic for inmates, ex-offenders and supervisees. Besides helping them cultivate positive values like patience and flexibility, it also calms their minds while working on their projects.At The Turning Point (TTP) Halfway House, supervisees gather for a quilling card-making session, an art technique where strips of paper are twisted, pinched, and folded into unique shapes and glued on surfaces. They can be used as greeting cards for loved ones, magnets on refrigerators, or framed as artwork to display at home!The supervisees have brought their creative visions to life in the form of exquisite designs. They would love to have you visit the TTP booth over the weekends during the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022!At the YR CAF 2022, happening from 5 to 13 November 2022, expect a variety of artwork and beautiful poetry exhibitions throughout the event, with baked treats, merchandise for sale, and live music performances over the two weekends only! Get an insight into inmates' and ex-offenders' skills, hopes, and desires; you'll be surprised at how talented they are!Show your support for second chances. See you at the festival!YRCAF2022SG4SecondChancesBeyondSecondChances

Dr Felicia Low, a renowned visual artist and art educator since 1999, tells us about her involvement with CANVAS Art as a mentor, teaching inmates how to express themselves through their artworks with a creative flair. With the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022, many inmate artists have a platform to share their talents and artwork in public. Lets find out more about Dr Lows experience in mentoring the inmates! ?It has been a great experience working with the inmates, especially in understanding their ideas and what they wish to achieve. All of the inmates talked about their families and wanted to express the meaning of their relationships with their loved ones through their artworks. Despite challenges, the inmates did their best to work with what they had and completed their artworks in their own unique way. ?There was one inmate who was afraid to paint anything bigger than A6 paper at the start. It took her about four weeks to finally have the confidence to paint on a larger piece of A1 paper, and she was able to do so independently. I was very proud that she was able to overcome her fears and was able to motivate herself to try something new towards a successful end.------ Enjoy meaningful artwork, beautiful poetry, baked treats, and live music performances over the weekend by supervisees and ex-offenders, at the YR CAF 2022, happening from 5 to 13 November 2022! Organised in collaboration with and , YR CAF 2022 is a one-of-a-kind experience that showcases creative expressions, allowing inmates and ex-offenders to convey their desires to change for a better future, for themselves and their families. Show your support for second chances. See you at the festival!YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Keep Calm and Carry Yarn You can now pick up crocheting for a good cause! Show your support for second chances by crocheting a Yellow Ribbon pin, with materials provided in our DIY crochet pack! Sign up (Link in Bio) and redeem your free DIY Yellow Ribbon Pack at the Yellow Ribbon Communiyy Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022. Registration will close on 21 October 2022 or once fully redeemed. Project Crochet is an initiative organised by Yellow Ribbon Project (YRP) in collaboration with .ravelled, and will be taking place from 5 to 13 November 2022.There will also be a free crocheting workshop that you can attend too! Stay tuned as we share more details about YR CAF 2022, see you there!YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances ProjectCrochet

Zane (not his real name) is one of the participating inmates whose poetry will be showcased at the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YR CAF) 2022, happening from 5 to 13 November 2022!He shared about his desire to upgrade himself, viewing education as an important means to aid his rehabilitation and reintegration. After entering the Prison School, Zane took the GCE 'N' and 'O' Level examinations in 2019 and 2020 respectively, and is now studying hard for the GCE 'A' Level examination! Zane's poem depicts the life story of a dutiful and filial son who loved his mother but left her disappointed after being caught engaging in criminal activities. Now, the son longs to be accepted by his mother again and return to the comfort of his home.To read Zane's poem, along with beautiful poetry by other participating inmates, do head down to YR CAF 2022!Organised in collaboration with and , YR CAF 2022 is a one-of-a-kind experience featuring art, poetry, handicraft , confectionary , and live music performances by supervisees and ex-offenders.These creative expressions depict the hopes and desires of inmates and ex-offenders to change their lives for their loved ones. We hope to see you there at the event! YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Recently, in collaboration with , inmates flexed their creative prowess to create and recite original poems for their families and loved ones during a Family Joint Session facilitated by on 3 September 2022. The poems will be featured at the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YRCAF) 2022!Themed, 'Home is where the heART is', the YRCAF 2022 is a physical event where inmates and ex-offenders express themselves through painting, poetry, music, and more! Being able to express their feelings through art is a form of rehabilitation that helps to bring inmates and ex-offenders closer to their families. If you're a fellow art enthusiast, or you want to SupportSecondChances, or are simply curious to find out more about the works of our talented inmates and ex-offenders, SaveTheDate for the upcoming YRCAF 2022, happening from 5 to 13 November 2022.You can expect a delightful and meaningful festival that is filled with handmade arts and crafts, delicious confectionery, free workshops, and enjoy live music performances over the weekends!Ready to get artsy with us? Stay tuned as we share more details about YRCAF 2022! YRCAF2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Muhammad Hareez Azmi has been with Yellow Ribbon Singapore for over two years. As an Assistant Associate, Transition Skills, Skills, he ensures that every beneficiary is given the opportunity to attend courses that allow them to gain the relevant industry skills required as part of their employment preparation.When asked about his greatest challenge at work, he shared that the COVID-19 pandemic had caused a disruption to the conduct of classes."At the national level, the government has relaxed safe management measures and we are gradually resuming our lives to pre-pandemic days. However, unlike classes conducted in public, classes conducted inside prisons could still be easily affected by the pandemic in view of the dense environment in prisons. It was definitely a challenge for our team, but with careful planning, we ensured that our beneficiaries were still able to receive the help and training needed in a safe environment."Hareez feels proud that his work at Yellow Ribbon Singapore expands the ex-offenders' employability skills, giving them a better chance at being employed and facilitating reintegration into society. Like Hareez, if you support second chances and seek a fulfilling career which aids in the reintegration of ex-offenders into society, click link in bio!SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Meet RO Hafidah Abdul Hamid, a Reintegration Officer from the (SPS), whose rollerblading journey began at 15 years old when her parents gifted her a pair of rollerblades for passing her exams! As a Reintegration Officer with SPS' Community Corrections Command, RO Hafidah's day-to-day entails engaging supervisees and overseeing their supervision and reintegration needs. She cheekily mentioned that at first, it seemed almost as if she was the mother figure to her supervisees. RO Hafidah recalls the surreal feeling she felt at a charity event. She was tasked to allocate groceries to the needy and felt good to be able to guide and work together with her supervisees for the charity event.Like RO Hafidah, if you too are passionate to show your support for second chances, register now for the Yellow Ribbon Virtual Race 2022 via the link in our bio. YRrace2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

RACE FLAG-OFF!HURRAY! The Yellow Ribbon Race 2022 physical run/walk has started. Despite the downpour , our race participants started off with high spirits ! This year, the Yellow Ribbon Prison Run is rebranded to the Yellow Ribbon Race with the theme I Race for Second Chances! - a run to celebrate second chances and unlock the second prison for inmates and ex-offenders. Racing with a purpose, our race participants are running/walking either 6km or 10km routes. They are determined to show their support for the cause. Let's do this! PS: To all race participants, we will see you at the race end-point and have a great time at YR Carnival!Special thanks to , Deputy Prime Minister, Minister for Finance, .ylm, Minister for Communications and Information, Second Minister for Home Affairs and , Minister of State, Ministry of Home Affairs and Ministry of National Development for being a part of the event!YRrace2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

If you are participating in the Yellow Ribbon Race 2022 physical run at Changi Prison Complex this Sunday, 25 September 2022, drop by Project Crochet's booth and take home your very own Yellow Ribbon crochet pack(s)!Project Crochet, an initiative started by the Yellow Ribbon Project (YRP), is a collaboration where YRP volunteers from Singapore Management University (), supervisees from halfway houses and shelters, along with inmates and ex-offenders, crochet yellow ribbons to show their support for second chances. The DIY YR crochet pack consists of one Yellow Ribbon Pin along with materials* to crochet your own YR Pin. Try your hand at crocheting! Let's show our support for inmates and ex-offenders' rehabilitation journey, which involves a series of unravelling and restarting, just like crocheting.*YR crochet pack includes a crochet hook, yarn needle, brooch pin and yellow yarnYRrace2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances

Meet CaptainOfLives, RO Muhammad Hafiz Bin Samad, a Senior Reintegration Officer from , who is taking part in the Yellow Ribbon Race (YRR) 2022!As a fan of water sports, Hafiz stumbled upon kayaking as part of his Co-Curricular Activity (CCA) eight years ago and fell in love with the sport after experiencing the adrenaline rush it provides and beautiful scenery seen along the way.Hafiz is an ardent supporter of second chances and finds it heartening when inmates place their trust and confidence in Prison Officers by confiding in them. He encourages everyone to be an advocate of second chances by registering for the YRR 2022 Virtual Edition and taking part via the three modes - Foot, Water and Wheels !Register for the virtual race via the link in bio!*All race sign-ups will receive a YRR 2022 race pack.YRrace2022 SG4SecondChances BeyondSecondChances
